>>619131750
Should I play the EO games in order or should I skip any?
Remake or originals? (Give reasons for this)

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>619137046
You'll get a range of opinions but I'd say there are two ways to go about it
Play in order, risk getting filtered by some of the jank in the first two, but then be able to experience every game in the series while appreciating the constant QoL improvements
Option two is to start with III, as it's a much smoother experience, then play in order all the way to Nexus, and then go back to I and II at some point if you're starving for more EO, but perhaps get a worse experience because their clunk stands out more having experienced later games. If you're not the kind to get filtered by jank and some really poor balance in a few cases, do the former.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>619137046
The order doesn't matter. EOIV is the easiest so you can start there. Each has unique experience so you can try them all.
The remakes add a story mode, new classes locked behind that story mode, and a mechanic where any class can use any skill. The story mode in the first remake spoils the plot twist of the original game

>how do you even get that
Onyx Roses is the ingame name, it's the one weapon the game gives for free so if you beat chapter 1 you have it, either way here are some tips but it might be too overwhelming idk:

if you have magic available you can use a torture attack (punch and kick at the same time), once they're at 2/3 of their heath and it's a guaranteed kill and they drop an angel weapon, these are really good.
you can also use Tetsuzanko and Stilleto (you buy these moves from the store), they use 3 magic iirc to summon an instant wickedweave, and they either push enemies away or stomps them into the ground
every weapon has a hold property, both Scarborough Fair and Onyx Roses keep shooting for a while while you hold the attack, holding each punch and kick with the Onyx Roses is how you fire and stagger enemies easily.
both of these guns are the easiest to learn dodge offsest as well, while you're holding the punches/kicks and bayonetta is firing you can dodge and she'll keep shooting if you don't let go, this way you can continue the combostring instead of restarting it every time you dodge.
buy bat within, it extends the dodge window for free

it's a lot but i hope at least some of it helped

It was the single best game ever made until the Monoclegate happened and they started treating the game like a business rather than the passion project it started as. They had promised with Incarna the next generation of gaming, being able to virtually mingle with other players in stations while flying around the universe. After the Monoclegate and the disappointment of WIS, everything went downhill. Its really a classic story of hubris; taking on too much and wanting to revolutionize the world and forgetting the roots. Nowadays the game is but a shadow of its former glory. I'll never forget the early days in 2004 when fleeing from notorious pirates who were so good at ganking in the game that the Devs had to re-program the game to make the police more deadly. The scams and the plots, the political map which was constantly moving. The high IQ plays. The Megathron I spent a whole summer mining for and then losing to a gate camp to the pirate Zaphod Beeblebrox. What a game, never will be anything like it again.

>>619135272

Right honestly looks better. Left has that weird "everyone is illuminated but greasy" lighting that makes me think of Mass Effect 1 scenes. I can't tell, from the left screenshot alone, whether it takes place outside of a tent or within the tent; the lighting looks like it could be coming from a torch on the wall or something. The right screenshot clearly takes place outside, the lighting looks proper, and whatever sweat/shininess the characters have looks normal as opposed to everyone being greasy-looking. I like the detail of the unevenness of his skin around the scar, making it look like a healed wound and less like a decal on his face.

I'm generally against 'remasters' like this. The Dark Souls remaster arbitrarily made some things REALLY shiny for some reason in a way that looks bad/sticks out from the assets that weren't altered, making it hard to take even a single screenshot without it being obvious that the assets are mismatched. The game takes place in a dying world, everything is dirty and falling apart from lack of maintenance, and you're out there with a fresh layer of polish on your armor. I greatly prefer the original over the remaster. With this remaster, though? At least, going off of this screenshot? It looks properly done, like an actual improvement. It looks better.
